title: Reef name list

embed.description: What is the Nautilus-themed Artificial Reef? The Nautilus artificial reef was the final reward in Ocean Week 2015. Players from all around Oceania played games with specific Ocean Week champions (like Fizz, Nami or Nautilus) to contribute one point per win. The points required to construct the artificial reef was a hefty 275,000 from all Oceanic players.

body:
Why am i not there? me and my friends who earned WAY enough points are not there. I don't think our names are offensive but were not there. Can someone please explain i was super exited about this.
thanks 
DK Dizza

replies.body: Riot kind of screwed a lot of people with this mural thing. I played my games with my friend who is on the mural and even played a few on my own. He's on the wall... I'm not. I made sure to earn 10 points. Been playing this game for 7 years, and I don't even get my name on Riots mural. Feels shitty.
This is not the Ocean Week 2016 Mural. This is the Ocean Week 2015 Reef.

Maybe read this here: http://boards.oce.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/miscellaneous/LuyUu4E2-notice-nautilus-reef-and-you

Edit: If you are definitely sure, then remember if you have changed your summoner name since the event, it will be your old summoner name on the reef instead of your current one.
thanks i just read it. i haven't changed my summoner name since like 2014 and i know i got over 30 points or so. so yea not sure why its not there.{{sticker:zombie-nunu-bummed}}

30 points would have been extremely hard to get since the 2015 challenge period was so short. Are you certain you're not thinking of Ocean Week 2016?
Send a ticket to support in if you're sure, otherwise hit me up with a reply and I can take a look when we're back in the office tomorrow.

A lot of summoners are apparently having the same issue.
I got enough points for the 2015 and the 2016 one.
I heard this from someone but I don't know if its valid.
But apparently so many people achieved the "3" points limit that you guys actually increased the point limits to a much higher number.
I don't know if its true, but if it is that's a pretty BS thing to do. I think we only had a few days (2-3) to play on 2015 ocean week.
I just feel like some of us had the rug pulled out from our feet's. With a sign on the ceiling saying "Lol you didn't do enough".

Can you deny/Confirm the point increase needed? (I'm sure Maraduar said you only needed 3)
And what about us summoners who had the points but didn't have our names put on the list.
Do we all have to submit a ticket for this?

Absolutely not true. 3 points was the required amount in Ocean Week 2015 to end up on the statue and it remained at 3 points despite the community smashing through it in a couple of days.

So far **every single summoner** who's name isn't there but has claimed that they made it on the statue in OW 2015 has been found to be incorrect. Many of them didn't even participate in OW 2015 and are just confusing last years event with the points they earned in 2016's Ocean Week, which instead gets them on the Community Mural Wall if they earned 10+ points during Ocean Week 2016.

Yeah but I did.
I had to walk to a friends house just so I could play ocean week.
I could only do it for one day, so I managed to get my 3-4 points before heading off.
I'm glad that you could deny those weird things I've heard but I did participate, and I'm not on the list :(
Sorry to say, but it appears that the games you played were all after the Ocean Week challenge phase had ended (when the community unlocked the statue).

I thought that this might have been the case, But I could have sworn I played on the second day.
Because the moment I saw the event I rushed to play it.

This kinda sucks, also as a side note.
Why couldn't summoners who earned points after the event was reach get their names on the stature?
From what I saw, you still had plenty of room, 1 plate almost had no names on it.

The expectation we set was that the 3 points was required to be earned before the statue was unlocked. 42006 summoners made it on to the statue this way and we had to stick by our initial conditions to honour their efforts.

Yeah fair enough, but it wouldn't  be the first time you guys went past your initial conditions.
I still remember a few times where you guys made things go on for another few days (A week at one point) for certain events.
(I don't know why some events get extra days while others don't, popularity I guess)

As much as I am really sad about it, I still could have sworn that I got 3 points before that.
